main event: A bright, burning object was observed falling from East to Northeast in Norfolk, Virginia on 2-3 August 1958.
interesting points: The object was white in color., The observation lasted for 30-39 seconds., There were insufficient data for evaluation of the object's nature., The source of the sighting was recorded as civilian., The report referenced a potential for the object being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical, but concluded with insufficient data.
witness description: Master of the Ship Urania, a Liberian tanker
